column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: NO TURN ON RED.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: One-way street ahead
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 3. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Stop.
column8: Construction warning.

column2: 4. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.
column6: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
column10: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.

column2: 5. If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
column6: look towards the left side of the road.
column8: stay calm and get out of the aggressive driver's way.

column2: 6. Braking distance is affected by:
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 7. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: signal.

column2: 8. When a driver has their left arm and hand extended upward, the driver plans to:
column6: come to a stop.
column8: go straight ahead.

column2: 9. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column6: at an intersection.
column8: at a yield sign.

column2: 10. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 11. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column8: No U-turns

column2: 13. If you see an animal on the road:
column4: pass the animal as fast as possible.
column6: be very cautious.
column8: honk your horn.

column2: 14. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: on multiple lane highways.
column8: at most intersections.

column2: 15. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column6: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column6: Wrong Way
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: No left turn
column8: Road curves ahead

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column6: U-turns are prohibited
column8: You may proceed only if the way is clear

column2: 19. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: regardless of your direction.

column2: 20. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: go faster.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turns
column8: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 32. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 33. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 34. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column6: reduce
column8: maintain

column2: 35. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column8: check your rearview mirror.

column2: 36. This sign means drivers should:
column6: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.

column2: 37. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column6: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column8: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column10: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.

column2: 38. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: Open intersection ahead

column2: 40. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
